Luis Miguel (stylized onscreen as Luis Miguel, la serie) is an American biographical television series produced by Gato Grande Productions along to Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studios for Netflix and Telemundo.[2][3] It is an authorized version on the life of the Mexican singer Luis Miguel.[4] It stars Diego Boneta as the titular character.[5][6] Filming began on November 16, 2017.[7]

On 22 April 2018, Karla Gonzales showrunner of the series confirmed that the show has been renewed for a second season.[8]

Plot[edit]

Before being known as Luis Miguel. Micky, as his family called him, finds a great sastifaction of love and security alongside his beloved mother Marcela (Anna Favella) and his younger brother Alex (Juanpa Zurita). Singer of natural talent, he is gaining recognition and popularity until he turns 11, when his father, Luis Rey (Óscar Jaenada), obsessively gives himself the task of turning his son into the superstar that he himself did not manage to be. As Micky grows and becomes a pop star of the time, with the name of Luis Miguel (Diego Boneta) the problems associated with fame and the protection of his private life and his great loves begin. While the world falls in love with the masculine image of a tanned young man with a beautiful white smile and fascinating lifestyle in Acapulco, which was the hallmark of his career, what exists behind this reality is how fame and fortune can impact a family.

Cast[edit]

Main[edit]

  • Diego Boneta as Luis Miguel
  • Izan Llunas as Child Luis Miguel[9]
  • Óscar Jaenada as Luis Rey[7]
  • Paulina Dávila as Mariana Yazbek[10]
  • Martín Bello as Tito
  • Anna Favella as Marcela Basteri
  • César Bordón as Hugo López[11]
  • Juanpa Zurita as Alex Basteri[12]
  • Vanessa Bauche as Rosy Esquivel[11]

Recurring and guest[edit]

  • Alfonso Borbolla as Raúl Velasco
  • León Peraza as Andrés García[13]
  • Alberto Caneva as Sergio Basteri
  • Sergio Lanza as Juan Carlos Calderón
  • Javier Gómez as Jaime
  • Luis de la Rosa as Young Luis Miguel
  • Vicente Tamayo as Bobby, based on Roberto Palazuelos[14]
  • Alexis Ortega as Burro, based on Jorge van Rankin
  • Kevin Holt as Miguel Alemán Magnani
  • Gabriel Nuncio as El Doc
  • Pilar Santacruz as Sophie, based on Stephanie Salas[15]
  • Andrés Almeida as Armando Serna[11]
  • Arturo Barba as El Tigre Azcárraga, based on Emilio Azcárraga Milmo
  • Mario Zaragoza as General Durazo, based on Arturo Durazo Moreno[16]
  • Hugo Catalán as Moro, based on Alejandro González Iñárritu[17]
  • Albi De Abreu as Miguel Ángel Villegas
  • Isabel Burr as Adela
  • Marcela Guirado as Verónica Castro
  • Sofía Castro as Alina
  • Karla Carrillo as Conductora MTV
  • Aurora Gil as Cynthia Casas
  • Viridiana Olvera as Paty Chapoy
  • Pierre David as Armando Manzanero
  • Daniel Cubillo as Bebu Silvetti
  • Camila Sodi as Erika, based on Issabela Camil[18][19]

Cameo appearances[edit]

  • Luis Miguel as Himself[20]
  • Jorge van Rankin as Himself[20]
  • Toño Mauri as Himself[20]
  • Alejandro Basteri as Himself[20]

Broadcast history[edit]

On 9 April 2018, Telemundo published through its website Now Telemundo a preview of the first episode entitled "Primera Mirada".[21] The first episode of the series premiered on 12 April 2018 during an exclusive screening held in Beverly Hills, California,[22] as part of the presentation of the series,[22] Its official premiere was on 22 April 2018 on Telemundo at 9pm/8c, and in Spain and Latin America on Netflix after its broadcast on television, each episode is broadcast every Sunday.[23][24]

Episodes[edit]

No.Title Directed byWritten byOriginal release date US viewers
(millions) 
1"Cuando calienta el sol"[28]
"Nace El Sol de México[Note 1]"[29]		Humberto HinojosaSusana Casares & Daniel Krauze22 April 2018 (2018-04-22)0.95[25]
Luis Rey, the father of Luis Miguel discovers the enormous talent of his son at 10 years old and is responsible for managing his career and personal life. While, Micky meets his first love, Mariana Yazbek.
2"La Malagueña"[28]
"Luis Miguel despide a su padre[Note 1]"[30]		Natalia Beristáin & Humberto HinojosaSusana Casares & Carolina Rivera29 April 2018 (2018-04-29)0.88[31]
Micky sings on TV, for the first time. After obeying his father for many years and being exploited at will, Luis Miguel opens his eyes to so many lies, demands and manipulation.
3"Yo que no vivo sin ti"[28]
"Marcela se humilla por su hijo[Note 1]"[32]		Natalia Beristáin & Humberto HinojosaFlavia Atencio & Susana Casares6 May 2018 (2018-05-06)0.82[33]
Luis Rey manages to have Micky sing at the wedding of the daughter of the president of Mexico: he uses Marcela, turning a blind eye to a powerful man who wants her. Luis Miguel looks for his own style.
4"Culpable o no"[28]
"Luis Miguel rompe con Mariana[Note 1]"[34]		Natalia Beristáin & Humberto HinojosaSusana Casares13 May 2018 (2018-05-13)0.83[35]
Luis Miguel is devastated by his break with his first love and the composer, Juan Carlos Calderón, is inspired by his pain and writes "Culpable o No", one of his most emblematic themes.
5"La chica del bikini azul"[28]
"El padre de Luismi lo estafa[Note 1]"[36]		Humberto HinojosaDaniel Krauze20 May 2018 (2018-05-20)0.87[37]
Luis Miguel, isolated in his spiral of evasion, alcohol and sex, does not know that his father and uncle divert funds to accounts in Switzerland. A fan ends up in the hospital, due to the imprudence of Luis Miguel.
6"Mamá Mamá"[28]
"Luis Rey droga a Mickey[Note 1]"[38]		Humberto HinojosaFlavia Atencio & José Luis Gutiérrez Arias27 May 2018 (2018-05-27)0.62[39]
The ambition of Luis Rey has no limits; he bribes a doctor to prescribe Luis Miguel's ephedrine, and so he continues with the film and his concerts.
7"La Incondicional"[28]
"Luis Miguel abre los ojos[Note 1]"[40]		Humberto HinojosaSusana Casares & Carolina Rivera3 June 2018 (2018-06-03)0.67[41]
Outraged by the farces of his father, Luis Miguel interrogates him about the whereabouts of his mother and demands that he return the 20 million dollars, which he stole. If not, Luis Miguel will be imprisoned, for not paying taxes.
8"Alguien como tú"[28]
"Micky pierde su virginidad[Note 1]"[42]		Humberto HinojosaDaniel Krauze10 June 2018 (2018-06-10)0.66[43]
Concerned about the change of voice of his son to his 13 years, Luis Rey hires a prostitute, so that Micky becomes a man. Luis Miguel is reunited with an old friend, Erika Camil.
9"Todo el amor del mundo"[28]
"Luismi busca a su madre[Note 1]"[44]		Humberto HinojosaSusana Casares17 June 2018 (2018-06-17)0.62[45]
Luis Miguel is affected, to discover that his mother was in a psychiatric, in the Canary Islands, by a strong depression and wants to know where he is. The farce of Luis Rey comes to light.
10"Decídete"[28]
"Una pista de Marcela[Note 1]"[46]		Humberto HinojosaDaniel Krauze24 June 2018 (2018-06-24)0.74[47]
With the help of the private investigator, Luis Miguel enters the psychiatric hospital, to confirm if the mysterious woman in the photograph is her mother. Luis Rey is on the verge of bankruptcy.
11"Marcela"[28]
"Lo que marcó la vida de Luismi[Note 1]"[48]		Humberto HinojosaSusana Casares & Daniel Krauze1 July 2018 (2018-07-01)0.84[49]
Marcela leaves Luis Rey and he forces Luis Miguel to choose who he prefers to live with. Luis Miguel dedicates the theme, "Marcela" to his mother and it is the last time he sees her and that she appears in public.
12"No me platiques más"[28]
"Micky gana su primer Grammy[Note 1]"[50]		Humberto HinojosaSusana Casares & Daniel Krauze8 July 2018 (2018-07-08)0.65[51]
As one of the youngest in the industry, Luis Miguel at age fifteen, is recognized with this award from the US Academy of Arts and Sciences, for the song “Me gustas tal como eres”.
13"No me puedes dejar así"[28]
"Luis Rey muere con su secreto[Note 1]"[52]		Humberto HinojosaDaniel Krauze15 July 2018 (2018-07-15)0.74[27]
Luis Miguel begs his father, for the last time, to tell him where his mother is. Luis Rey takes the secret to his grave, but a new hopeful track emerges. Luismi recognizes his daughter.

The first soundtrack of the series, titled Luis Miguel La Serie Soundtrack, was released on 22 April 2018.[54][55]
